greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: n-th derivative of f_{n+1} at x=1, where f_k is the k-th of all functions that are representable as x^x^...^x with m>=1 x's and parentheses inserted in all possible ways.
comment: The ordering of the functions f_k is defined in A215703: f_1, f_2, ... = x, x^x, x^(x^2), x^(x^x), x^(x^3), x^(x^x*x), x^(x^(x^2)), x^(x^(x^x)), x^(x^4), x^(x^x*x^2), ... .
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..400
maple: T:= proc(n) T(n):=`if`(n=1, [x], map(h-> x^h, g(n-1$2))) end:
f:= proc() local i, l; i, l:= 0, []; proc(n) while n>
nops(l) do i:= i+1; l:= [l[], T(i)[]] od; l[n] end
a:= n-> n!*coeff(series(subs(x=x+1, f(n+1)), x, n+1), x, n):
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Mar 06 2019
